intro: Satyrium gramineum, commonly known as the grass pinks, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Primulaceae. It is characterized by its slender, herbaceous stems and small, pink or white flowers arranged in racemes. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodland floors and stream banks. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, contributing to its common name. Satyrium gramineum is often found in temperate regions of Europe and Asia.
